Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 2. Draw the following lines to create loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.6, 0.0], End Point [0.4908, 0.3] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4908, 0.3], End Point [0.3, 0.3] - Line 4: Start Point [0.3, 0.3], End Point [0.1092, 0.3] - Line 5: Start Point [0.1092, 0.3], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop is closed and has 5 lines. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.6. 4. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units in the direction of the normal. Part 2 - Cylindrical Hole: 1. Create a new coordinate system for part 2 with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.225, 0.3, 0.0] 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with the following properties to create loop 1: - Center: [0.075, 0.075] - Radius: 0.075 The loop is closed and has 1 circle. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.15. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the Euler angles and translation vector provided in the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the sketch by 0.45 units in the direction of the normal. The final shape is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole on one side. part_1: - shape: "A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees." - length: 0.6 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.6 part_2: - shape: "A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter. The top and bottom of the cylinder are flat." - length: 0.15 - width: 0.15 - height: 0.45</description>
